org.jboss.msc.txn

Interface TaskBuilder<T>


  • public interface TaskBuilder<T>
    A builder for subtasks. Subtasks may be configured with dependencies and injections before being installed. Dependency tasks must be associated with the same transaction as the subtask being built, or a parent thereof.
    Author:
    David M. Lloyd, Richard Opalka

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      TaskBuilder<T> addDependencies(Collection<? extends TaskController<?>> dependencies)
      Add dependencies, if this subtask has not yet been executed.
      TaskBuilder<T> addDependencies(TaskController<?>... dependencies)
      Add dependencies, if this subtask has not yet been executed.
      TaskBuilder<T> addDependency(TaskController<?> dependency)
      Add a single dependency, if this subtask has not yet been executed.
      Transaction getTransaction()
      Get the transaction associated with this builder.
      TaskController<T> release()
      Release this task to begin execution.
      TaskBuilder<T> setClassLoader(ClassLoader classLoader)
      Set the class loader to use for this task.
      TaskBuilder<T> setExecutable(Executable<T> executable)
      Change the executable part of this task, or null to prevent the executable part from running.
      TaskBuilder<T> setRevertible(Revertible revertible)
      Set the revertible part of this task, or null if the task should not support rollback.

      • release

        TaskController<T> release()
        Release this task to begin execution. The given listener is called upon completion or failure, or immediately if this task was already released.
        Returns:
        the new controller
